#Text=Pennsylvania
#Text=Pennsylvania is a state in the eastern United States .

#Text=It is known for its Revolutionary War-era historical sites like Valley Forge , its large cities like Philadelphia and Pittsburgh , its farming regions , some occupied by the Amish , and a ( once)-strong industrial history .
#Text=With equally large swaths of cities and towns as fields and mountains , Pennsylvania is a rich and varied state , as well as a worthy travel destination .
#Text=Pennsylvania is bordered by the states of New Jersey , New York , Delaware , Maryland , West Virginia , and Ohio .
#Text=The main cities are Philadelphia and Pittsburgh , and other smaller cities such as Allentown , Erie , Reading , Bethlehem , and Scranton .
#Text=Cities
#Text=— the state capital
#Text=— largest city of the Lehigh Valley , third largest city in state
#Text=— home to Pennsylvania 's waterfront on Lake Erie , great for boating and beaches
#Text=— Birthplace of Hershey 's chocolate , home to Hersheypark .
#Text=— a relatively large city right at the heart of Amish country ; the birthplace of the battery-powered watch , and a good shopping destination for Amish goods
#Text=— " The City of Brotherly Love , " with lots of history and cheesesteaks , largest city in Pennsylvania .
#Text=— " The Steel City , " a scenic , multicultural , major city , 2nd largest in Pennsylvania .
#Text=Reading - birthplace of country/pop music artist Taylor Swift . ￼
#Text=/ Wilkes-Barre — coal region towns perhaps best known for TV 's The Office
#Text=— host to the annual Little League World Series
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=— the site of the most famous battlefield on U.S. soil , which saw the bloodiest battle and the turning point of the Civil War
#Text=Ricketts Glen State Park
#Text=— the third-largest " city " in the state , but only when the Nittany Lions football team is playing
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania is a geographically diverse state with a Great Lake on one shore and a major seaport on the other .

#Text=The climate of Pennsylvania is pleasant , with cold , often snowy winters , mild to hot , humid summers , and gorgeous green springtimes , and most notably , spectacular displays of colorful autumn foliage .
#Text=Pennsylvania hosts a number of vital cities , from Pittsburgh to Philadelphia .
#Text=The city of Philadelphia houses the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall , two major national historical landmarks .
#Text=The interior of the state has a number of subcultures worth exploring , including the famous Amish countryside , a religious community .
#Text=Pennsylvania is also home to a diverse group of people , with ethnic enclaves of black , Hispanic , and Southeast Asian populations in its major cities .
#Text=Pennsylvania is also diverse in that the Eastern and Southeastern parts of the state are urban and densely populated , while much of the rest of the state is rural and/or mountainous .
#Text=Talk

#Text=Most Pennsylvanians speak American English , although pound-for-pound its variety of regional dialects and accents is richer than any other state in the Union : the Western Pennsylvania ( " Pittsburghese " ) , Central Pennsylvania , Northeastern Pennsylvania , Southeastern Pennsylvania ( centered in Pennsylvania Dutch Country and heavily influenced by that language ; see below ) , and Philadelphia dialects are all audibly distinct from each other .
#Text=People from the Appalachian Mountains speak with a distinctive accent that is similar to a a Southern accent .
#Text=Travellers may well notice these different speech patterns , but it 's highly doubtful they 'll present any communication problem for anyone with a workable level of English proficiency .
#Text=Many of these accents are dying out , and younger people tend to speak with a general American accent .
#Text=Reading , Allentown , and Philadelphia all have sizable Spanish-speaking populations , and Philadelphia and Pittsburgh have their share of Asian , European , and other languages too .
#Text=Again , this should not pose a problem for English-speaking travellers , as most of these people speak English in addition to their native language .

#Text=Finally , though there are now smaller clusters in other states too , Pennsylvania remains the home of the large majority of speakers of the famous Pennsylvania Dutch ( Pennsilfaanisch Deitsch ) dialect of German .
#Text=Although widescale non-Amish use of the language faded circa 1950 , there are pockets of young people who are learning the language as a way to preserve their heritage .
#Text=By car
#Text=Pennsylvania is a densely populous state in a densely populous part of the country , with many roads in and out .
#Text=Interstate highways lead most traffic into the state .
#Text=Major national interstate highways leading to Pennsylvania include I-95 S from New England , I-95 N from the American South , and I-70 E , I-80 E & I-90 E from the American West and Midwest .
#Text=Specifically , clockwise from north of Harrisburg :
#Text=from Montreal & Ottawa to Scranton & Harrisburg : I-81 S.
#Text=from Boston to Scranton : I-90 W to I-84 W.
#Text=from Boston to the Lehigh Valley & Harrisburg : I-84 W to I-91 S to I-95 S to I-287 W to I-78 W.
#Text=from Boston to Philadelphia : I-84 W to I-91 S to I-95 S.
#Text=from New York City to Scranton : I-80 W.
#Text=from New York City to the Lehigh Valley & Harrisburg : I-78 W.
#Text=from New York City to Philadelphia : I-95 S.
#Text=from Baltimore to Philadelphia : I-95 N.
#Text=from Baltimore to Harrisburg : I-83 N.
#Text=from Baltimore to Pittsburgh : I-70 W.
#Text=from Washington , DC to Philadelphia : I-95 N.
#Text=from Washington , DC to Harrisburg : I-95 N to I-83 N.
#Text=from Washington , DC to Pittsburgh : I-270 W to I-70 W.
#Text=from West Virginia to Pittsburgh : I-79 N.
#Text=from Columbus & Indianapolis to Pittsburgh & Harrisburg : I-70 E.
#Text=from Cleveland to Pittsburgh : It 's close , but complicated .
#Text=from Cleveland & Chicago to Erie : I-90 E.
#Text=from Toronto & Buffalo to Erie : I- 90 W.
#Text=Also , U.S. Routes 219 , 15 , and 220 ( soon to be I-99 ) all enter the state at alternative points from both the north and south .
#Text=State-operated Welcome Centers and Comfort Facilities are found just inside the borders at all major crossings into Pennsylvania .
#Text=By train
#Text=Amtrak offers a total of nine different passenger train lines in or across the state of Pennsylvania .
#Text=A fair amount of these run between New York and Philadelphia , continuing to points south , such as Charlotte , and New Orleans .
#Text=The Pennsylvanian crosses a large swath of the state during its journey from New York to Pittsburgh , and the Keystone travels from New York to Harrisburg .
#Text=Pittsburgh and Philadelphia are also each connected to Chicago and Washington D.C.

#Text=An inexpensive and quick rail option to the Philadelphia region from New York City as well as its airports , is to take a New Jersey Transit train from Port Authority in lower Manhattan to Trenton Transportation Center in New Jersey .
#Text=At Trenton , transfer onto a SEPTA ( Southeastern Pennsylvania Transit Authority ) train to Center City Philadelphia .
